relation: internal energy at the critical point
textBeforeTable: Temperature- and pressure-dependent properties include: The common English name for a supported substance can be found using the . ThermodynamicData["name"] returns all properties with their values at STP. ThermodynamicData["name",{"Temperature"quantity1,"Pressure"quantity}]returns all properties using the supplied temperature and/or pressure to calculate values. Temperature and pressure values can also be supplied as an Association. If not otherwise specified, physical properties are given for standard temperature and pressure (293.15 K and 101325 pascals). Properties are returned using Quantity where appropriate. Properties that do not apply or are not known in a particular case are indicated by Missing[…]. ThermodynamicData["Properties"] gives a list of all properties available. ThermodynamicData[] gives a list of the available substances. DetailsDetails ThermodynamicData["name","property",{"Temperature"quantity1,"Pressure"quantity}] gives the value of the specific property for the substance at the specified temperature and pressure. ThermodynamicData["name","property"]
textAfterTable: "MolarDensity" density per molar mass "MolarEnthalpy" enthalpy per molar mass "MolarEntropy" entropy per molar mass "MolarInternalEnergy" internal energy per molar mass "MolarIsobaricHeatCapacity" heat capacity at constant pressure per molar mass "MolarIsochoricHeatCapacity" heat capacity at constant volume per molar mass "MolarSpecificVolume" molar volume "Phase" phase "SoundSpeed" speed of sound "SpecificVolume" specific volume "ThermalConductivity" thermal conductivity "Viscosity" dynamic viscosity , , and their molar forms are measured relative to their values at the boiling point of the substance. Triple point properties include: "TriplePointGasDensity" density of gas at the triple point "TriplePointLiquidDensity" density of liquid at the triple point "TriplePointPressure" pressure at the triple point "TriplePointSolidDensity" density of solid at the triple point "TriplePointTemperature" temperature at the triple point
